page.title: 12Transport.
page.content: Late in 1984 the Bancyfelin by-pass was opened. This new dual carriage way runs parallel to the old A40 and it has made a vast difference. On July 1 1985 the following vehicles were seen on the new road between 2-3pm.Travelling East-West,cars and light vans 396,lorries 85,caravans 18,motor bikes 3,army vehicles 10. Travelling West-East cars and light vans 245,lorries 117,caravans 5,army transport eight.18 buses werw also seen during the hour. The village of Bancyfelin is now very quiet,a ribbon development,most of the houses are alongside the old main road People can now park their cars outside their houses,cross the road fairly safely.Some farms have been divided by the new road and are served by under- passes.The village filling-station has closed and the pub lost passing trade.
